shapes3d

Class BezTube

  • java.lang.Object
    • shapes3d.Shape3D
      • shapes3d.Mesh2DCore
        • shapes3d.Mesh2DCoreWithCaps
          • shapes3d.BezTube
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PConstants, SConstants

    public class BezTube
extends Mesh2DCoreWithCaps
    This class represents a tube that follows a Bezier curve in 3D space.
    The actual tube path is defined by a Bezier3D object By default the bezier tube will have end caps. Each end cap can have its own
    • draw mode
    • fill color
    • stroke color
    • stroke weight
    • texture
    • visibility
    The methods to set the end cap properties can be found in the Mesh2DCoreWithCaps class documentation. The following constants should be used when specifying which cap(s) are to be affected. Tube.S_CAP Tube.E_CAP Tube.BOTH_CAP
    Author:
    Peter Lager

      • BezTube

        public BezTube(PApplet app,
       P_Bezier3D bez,
       float rad,
       int nbrSlices,
       int nbrSegments)
        Create a BezTube
        Parameters:
        app - the PApplet to draw this shape
        bez - the bezier curve to use as the tube centre
        rad - the radius of the tube
        nbrSlices - number of slices along length
        nbrSegments - number of sections around tube

      • BezTube

        public BezTube(PApplet app,
       P_Bezier3D bez,
       I_RadiusGen radGen,
       int nbrSlices,
       int nbrSegments)
        Create a BezTube
        Parameters:
        app - the PApplet to draw this shape
        bez - the bezier curve to use as the tube centre
        radGen - the radius generator for this tube
        nbrSlices - number of slices along length
        nbrSegments - number of sections around tube

      • BezTube

        public BezTube(PApplet app,
       P_Bezier3D bez,
       float rad,
       int nbrSlices,
       int nbrSegments,
       PVector orientation,
       PVector centreOfRotation)
        Create a tube.
        The Bezier control points are recalculated so to change the 'up' direction from the [0,1,0] axis to the new axis 'orientation'
        The Bezier control points are translated to make 'centreOfRot' the objects centre of rotation.
        Parameters:
        app - the PApplet to draw this shape
        bez - the bezier curve to use as the tube centre
        rad - the radius for this tube
        nbrSlices - number of slices along length
        nbrSegments - number of sections around tube
        orientation - the new up direction
        centreOfRotation - new centre of orientation

      • BezTube

        public BezTube(PApplet app,
       P_Bezier3D bez,
       I_RadiusGen rad,
       int nbrSlices,
       int nbrSegments,
       PVector orientation,
       PVector centreOfRotation)
        Create a tube.
        The Bezier control points are recalculated so to change the 'up' direction from the [0,1,0] axis to the new axis 'orientation'
        The Bezier control points are translated to make 'centreOfRot' the objects centre of rotation.
        Parameters:
        app - the PApplet to draw this shape
        bez - the bezier curve to use as the tube centre
        rad - the radius generator for this tube
        nbrSlices - number of slices along length
        nbrSegments - number of sections around tube
        orientation - the new up direction
        centreOfRotation - new centre of orientation

    • Method Detail

      • shapeOrientation

        public void shapeOrientation(PVector up,
                    PVector centreOfRot)
        Change the world position and rotation. For this shape we need to cahnge the control points and recalculate the mesh.
        If these are different from existing values then recalculate the shape.
        Overrides:
        shapeOrientation in class Shape3D
        Parameters:
        up - the axis to use for the 'up' direction
        centreOfRot - centre of rotation position

      • getNormal

        public PVector getNormal(float t)
        Get the normal vector of the tube at a given point along the tube.
        In fact the normal to a Bezier curve in 3D is not a vector but rather a plane. This does an approximation by interpolating between the normal vectors (created when the BezTube was instantiated) either side of 't'.
        Parameters:
        t - >=0 and <1
        Returns:
        the normal PVector at this point

      • restoreShape

        public void restoreShape()
        If the shape is being changed dynamically then the coordinates can become corrupted. Calling this method will recalculate all the mesh coordinates and normals.

        public void draw()
        Draw the tube.
